00003 #define EVENT_HEADER_SIZE               0x10
00004 #define X742_MAX_GROUPS                 0x04
00005 #define MAX_X742_CHANNEL_SIZE   0x09
00006 #define X742_FIXED_SIZE                 0x400
00007 
00008 /*****************************************************************************
00009 * GetNumEvents(char *buffer, uint32_t buffsize, uint32_t *numEvents)
00010 * Gets current number of event stored in the acquisition buffer
00011 *
00012 * [IN] buffer     : Address of the acquisition buffer 
00013 * [IN] bufferSize : Size of the data stored in the acquisition buffer
00014 * [OUT] numEvents : Number of events stored in the acquisition buffer
00015 *                                 : return  0 = Success; 
00016 ******************************************************************************/
00017 int32_t GetNumEvents(char *buffer, uint32_t buffsize, uint32_t *numEvents);
00018 
00019 /*****************************************************************************
00020 * GetEventPtr(char *buffer, uint32_t buffsize, int32_t numEvent, char **EventPtr)
00021 * Retrieves the event pointer of a specified event in the acquisition buffer
00022 *
00023 * [IN] buffer     : Address of the acquisition buffer 
00024 * [IN] bufferSize : Acquisition buffer size (in samples)
00025 * [IN] numEvents  : Number of events stored in the acquisition buffer
00026 * [OUT] EventPtr  : Pointer to the requested event in the acquisition buffer
00027 *                                 : return  0 = Success; 
00028 ******************************************************************************/
00029 int32_t GetEventPtr(char *buffer, uint32_t buffsize, int32_t numEvent, char **EventPtr);
00030 
00031 /******************************************************************************
00032 * X742_DecodeEvent(char *evtPtr, void **Evt)
00033 * Decodes a specified event stored in the acquisition buffer writing data in Evt memory
00034 * Once used the Evt memory MUST be deallocated by the caller!
00035 *
00036 * [IN]  EventPtr : pointer to the requested event in the acquisition buffer (MUST BE NULL)
00037 * [OUT] Evt      : event structure with the requested event data
00038 *                                : return  0 = Success; 
00039 ******************************************************************************/
00040 int32_t X742_DecodeEvent(char *evtPtr, void **Evt);
